Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Perivascular Adipose Tissue Preservation in Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting

Trial_Design.evidence: The unit of randomisation was the individual patient. Sample size calculation determined 200 participants were needed.

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients undergoing CABG, with eligibility criteria including age 18-75 and diagnosis of CAD.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to either PVAT-preserved (intervention) or PVAT-removed (control) groups.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was graft patency at 12 months post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the intervention and 100 to the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group showed a higher graft patency rate (91% vs. 81%, p = 0.046).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were mild and occurred in 3% of the intervention group and 1% of the control group.

Funding.evidence: This trial was funded by the National Institutes of Health.
